Around 5 September 2024 (between 4 September - 6 September), people protested and filmed a video addressed to Vladimir Putin and Alexander Bastrykin in Volgograd (Volgograd). People spoke out against spot development in the area around WWII memorial complex 'Mamayev Kurgan'. According to the participants, in the recent urban documentation changes, the territory was transformed from a zone of parks into a zone for multi-story construction.

On 5 September 2024, 25 people protested near the Bolshoye Simaginskoye lake in the village of Ilyichyovo (Vyborgskiy, Leningrad). On the same day, near the lake, a visiting court hearing was supposed to take place on a class action lawsuit filed by residents of the 'Krasavitsa' closed military town against the resort, which blocked the passage going from the military town to the beach. The day prior to the event, the hearing was moved to the courthouse, but 25 the plaintiffs still decided to show up in Ilyichyovo to protest both the 'hasty' court decision and the resort management.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Russia (2000-) Air Force
notes: On 4 September 2024, Ukrainian assault groups engaged in battles with the Russian forces, which were supported by artillery and air force, in the area around Malaya Loknya (Sudzhanskiy, Kursk). According to the Russian sources, Russian military repelled all the Ukrainian attacks. According to the Russian MoD, during 4 September (including in Malaya Loknya, Komarovka, Korenevo, Olgovka, Pogrebki) Ukrainian military lost up to 450 servicemen and 17 armored vehicles, 1 tank, 1 infantry fighting vehicle, 15 armored combat vehicles and 40 cars. [Russian MoD reported 450 fatalities. Coded as 10 fatalities split across 5 events. 2 fatalities coded to this event].

notes: On 3 September 2024, Ukrainian assault groups engaged in battles with the Russian forces, which were supported by artillery and air force, in the area around Maryevka (Sudzhanskiy, Kursk). According to the Russian sources, Russian military repelled all the Ukrainian attacks. According to the Russian MoD, during 3 September (including in Borki, Maryevka, Kamyshovka, Cherkasskoe Porechnoe) Ukrainian military lost up to 400 servicemen (25 of those were attributed to specific events) and 12 armored fighting vehicles, 3 artillery pieces, 1 MLRS, 12 vehicles and 2 engineering vehicles. (2 combat armored vehicles and 3 cars were attributed to specific events). [Russian MoD reported 400 fatalities. Coded as 10 fatalities split across 4 events. 2 fatalities coded to this event].

Around 3 September 2024 (as reported), police detained 530 migrants in Moscow - South-Western (Yugo-Zapadnyy, Moscow). They were taken to the police stations for the immigration policy compliance check and to see whether they had 'possibly committed other offenses'.

assoc_actor_2: LPR: Libertarian Party of Russia
notes: On 3 September 2024, police officers arrested a prominent member of the Libertarian Party of Russia in Moscow (Moscow). She was charged with disobeying police officers. Suspectedly, the real reason for the arrest was the fact that a week before her arrest, she had filed an application to hold a rally in support of Telegram founder Pavel Durov in Moscow on September 7.

Security measures: On 3 September 2024, Russian Government introduced restrictions on entry into the town of Kurchatov (Kurchatov, Kursk) The passage of personal vehicles into the town was prohibited during certain time intervals due to the federal state of emergency and the 'counter-terrorist operation' regimes active in the Kursk Region.

Around 30 August 2024 (as reported), police detained 73 migrants during a police raid in Sochi (Sochi, Krasnodar). Those 6 face an administrative fine and deportation from the country.

assoc_actor_2: Civilians (Russia); ER: United Russia; Government of Russia (2000-)
notes: On 28 August 2024, at least 2 Ukrainian drones attacked the village of Kurkovichi (Starodubskiy, Bryansk). As a result of 1 drone dropping of an explosive device, a residential building caught fire. Later, drones attacked the same area, where the Head of the municipal district administration was present, and firefighters were extinguishing the fire. 1 firefighter, the Head of the municipal administration and 1 civilian were injured. The fire was extinguished.

On 28 August 2024, Ukrainian military struck with (likely) missiles the Russian military engineering brigade that attempted to build a pontoon crossing near the village of Zvannoye (Glushkovskiy, Kursk). At least 6 vehicles were damaged or destroyed during the impact, including 'Ural' trucks uploaded with pontoon-bridge sections. Russian sources reported the loss of military personnel. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

assoc_actor_2: Labor Group (Russia)
notes: On 26 August 2024, an explosion took place on the oil refinery in Omsk (Omsk). The facility caught on fire, that was extinguished later that day. Targeting of oil and gas infrastructure has been happening across Russia. Social media channels that focus on covering war-related sabotage reposted the initial news about the incident. Despite the fact that nobody took responsibility for the event, sabotage can be suspected. 1 refinery worker died, 7 workers were injured.

Defusal: On 25 August 2024, an unidentified 'suspicious' object was found on the premises of the Jewish Museum and Tolerance Center in Moscow - North-Eastern (Severo-Vostochnyy, Moscow). Police officers were checking information about a bomb threat and found a 'suspicious object' in a flowerbed on the museum grounds. The press service of the Russian Police reported that following the inspection, the police discovered and retrieved 'some object.' What they were talking about was not specified.

notes: Around 21 August 2024 (between 20 August - 22 August), according to Russian sources, Ukrainian forces engaged in battles with Russian forces, who took up defensive positions in the building of women's penal colony No. 11 in the village of Malaya Loknya (Sudzhanskiy, Kursk). Several dozen Russian soldiers have dug in around the prison building, erected barricades, and are using watchtowers as firing positions. Ukrainian soldiers from 95th Separate Polesie Assault Brigade, in turn, are attacking the colony with 'Marder' infantry fighting vehicles and drones. It is unknown whether the inmates were in the prison, there were no reports about prisoner evacuation from the facility. Casualties unknown.

source: Activatica; Argumenty I Fakty; Caucasian Knot; Charter-97; ITAR-TASS; Kommersant; Nasha Niva
notes: On 18 August 2024, Ukrainian Directorate of Intelligence launched kamikaze drones at an oil depot in Proletarsk (Proletarskiy, Rostov). Russian military intercepted a few drones, the debris that fell on the 'Kavkaz' oil depot warehouse premises caused diesel fuel to catch fire. When the firefighters attempted to extinguish the fire they were attacked by drones once again. The fire continued to burn for 16 days (before it was extinguished) on a territory of 10 square km, and according to some sources, led to a serious deterioration in air quality in the city. 49 firefighters were injured in the result of fire, subsequent explosions and during the fire extinguishing process. 30 fuel tanks, each of which can contain up to 500 square meters of fuel were destroyed or damaged.
On 18 August 2024, Russian Military shelled with (likely) artillery the positions of Ukrainian military near the village of Cherkasskaya Konopelka (Sudzhanskiy, Kursk). Casualties unknown.
Around 18 August 2024 (between 16 August - 20 August), Ukrainian military gained control over the village of Nechaev (Bolshesoldatskiy, Kursk). It Is unknown if there were battles.

On 17 August 2024, Russian Military shelled with (likely) artillery the positions of Ukrainian military near the village of Kositsa (Sudzhanskiy, Kursk). According to Russian MoD, Ukrainian forces that were targeted consisted of manpower and vehicles from the 22nd, 61st, 115th mechanized, and 82nd airborne assault brigades. Casualties unknown.

On 17 August 2024, Russian Military shelled with (likely) artillery the positions of Ukrainian military near the village of Novaya Sorochina (Sudzhanskiy, Kursk). According to Russian MoD, Ukrainian forces that were targeted consisted of manpower and vehicles from the 22nd, 61st, 115th mechanized, and 82nd airborne assault brigades. Casualties unknown.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Russia (2000-) Air Force; Military Forces of Russia (2000-) Marines
notes: On 17 August 2024, Ukrainian Military engaged in battles with Russian forces supported by artillery and aviation in and around the town of Korenevo (Korenevskiy, Kursk). Ukrainian forces were supported by armored vehicles. According to Ukrainian social media, Ukrainian military captured the town, defeated the Russian Marines of the 810th Brigade and captured the company commander of the 1st motorized rifle battalion of the same brigade. Russian sources, including Russian MoD, denied the statements and claimed that the town in still under Russian control. Both sides reported battles in the area. Russian MoD also stated that Ukraine lost 1 tank and 11 armored vehicles during battles in Korenevo and near Russkoye Porechnoye (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 17 August 2024, Russian forces launched 'Smerch' missiles at Kramatorsk, Donetsk. Civilian infrastructure was damaged. 1 civilian was injured.
On 17 August 2024, Russian forces shelled Kozacha Lopan, Kharkiv. 1 civilian was killed.

On 17 August 2024, Russian forces clashed with Ukrainian forces near Zavitne, Donetsk. More than 270 Russian servicemen were killed near Hrodivka, Myroliubivka, Mykolaivka, Novohrodivka, Zavitne, Novotroitskoye, Vozdvyzhenka and Zavitne. 33 fatalities coded to this event.

assoc_actor_2: Women (Russia)
notes: Around 17 August 2024 (between 6 August - 27 August), according to the Russian sources, Ukrainian soldiers shot a civilian woman in one of the villages in the Sudzhanskiy district (coded as Sudzha (Sudzhanskiy, Kursk)). 3 Ukrainian soldiers (including 1 foreign mercenary) entered the woman's home and shot 1 woman after she called them 'fascists'. The woman died.

Around 17 August 2024 (between 6 August - 27 August), according to the Russian sources, Ukrainian military shot with tanks and small arms moving civilian cars in an unidentified location in the Sudzhanskiy district (coded as Sudzha (Sudzhanskiy, Kursk)). As a result of a tank shell hitting the vehicle, 1 civilian man died, 1 was injured. After gunfire, 2 civilians were injured.
